meanings.definition: To straighten or separate crossed limbs or objects.
meanings.sent1: She carefully uncrossed her legs to get more comfortable.
meanings.sent2: Please uncross the wires to avoid a short circuit.
meanings.sent3: The magician uncrossed the tangled ropes with a flick of his wand.
meanings.sent4: He uncrossed his arms, opening up to the idea.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor demonstrated how to uncross the arms for a better stretch.

meanings.sent1: The construction crew worked on uncrossing the road for smoother traffic flow.
meanings.sent2: She focused on uncrossing the misunderstandings between the two parties.
meanings.sent3: The team uncrossed the maze of red tape to get the project approved.
meanings.sent4: By uncrossing the fallen tree, they cleared the path for hikers.
meanings.sent5: Uncrossing the cluttered path, she found her way through the forest.

meanings.definition: To reverse the effects of crossing or crossing out.
meanings.sent1: He regretted crossing out his mistake and tried to uncross it.
meanings.sent2: The teacher showed the students how to uncross the wrong answers on their tests.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to uncross the lines in the sketch to create a different effect.
meanings.sent4: She carefully uncrossed the words she had hastily scribbled out.
meanings.sent5: Uncrossing the errors, he made the document look neat and organized.
